Module imagingbook.common
Package imagingbook.common.util

Interface DynamicProperties

All Known Implementing Classes:
BinaryRegion, SegmentationBackedRegion
public interface DynamicProperties
Defines a primitive mechanism for attaching arbitrary properties to an object at runtime. Objects of any type may be attached and no type checking is done at compile time, i.e., the required type casts are inherently unsafe. An implementing class only needs to define method getPropertyMap(). The functionality is basically the same as HashMap but definition as an interface avoids having to subclass HashMap. Usage example: 
     public class Foo implements DynamicProperties {
         ...
     }

     Foo f = new Foo();
     double[] x = {1, 2, 3, 4};
     f.setProperty("SomeDoubleArray", x);
     ...
     double[] y = (double[]) f.getProperty("SomeDoubleArray");

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested Classes
    Modifier and Type
    Interface
    Description
    static class 
    DynamicProperties.PropertyMap
    The underlying hash map, to be instantiated by implementing classes.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    default void
    clearAllProperties()
    Removes all properties.
    default Object
    getProperty(String key)
    Retrieves the specified region property.
    DynamicProperties.PropertyMap

    Returns an instance of DynamicProperties.PropertyMap with keys of type String and values of type Object.
    default void

    Removes the property associated with the specified key if defined, otherwise does nothing.

  • Method Details

    • getPropertyMap

      DynamicProperties.PropertyMap getPropertyMap()
      Returns an instance of DynamicProperties.PropertyMap with keys of type String and values of type Object. Implementing classes must define this method, which will typically return a reference to a local map instance. The returned object must not be null.
      Returns:
      the DynamicProperties.PropertyMap associated with the implementing instance

    • setProperty

      default void setProperty(String key, Object value)
      Sets the specified property of this region to the given value.
      Parameters:
      key - the key of the property (may not be null)
      value - the value associated with this property (may not be null)
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the supplied key or value is null

    • getProperty

      default Object getProperty(String key)
      Retrieves the specified region property. IllegalArgumentException is thrown if the property is not defined.
      Parameters:
      key - the name of the property (may not be null)
      Returns:
      the value of the associated property
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the supplied key is null

    • removeProperty

      default void removeProperty(String key)
      Removes the property associated with the specified key if defined, otherwise does nothing.
      Parameters:
      key - the name of the property

    • clearAllProperties

      default void clearAllProperties()
      Removes all properties.
